history.content:
I haven't taken CS 188, but from what I understand from other people its a very fun/interesting CS class with a lower workload than most.

CS 61C was by far my favorite lower division course and taught me a great deal about how a computer works at a fundamental level, and I still run into questions related to the material during interviews. CS 188 is an important class, but there's a reason why 61C is required. 

~~~~~~~~~~

Some people think 188 is useless. IIRC 188 focuses mostly on stuff like agent planning so you don't really need it for NLP. I still personally found it to be a really fun class though. Also check out info 159!

~~~~~~~~~~

I loved 188 and it was one of my favorite classes at Cal! Gives you a great solid foundation for future AI work. I think 61C is important and somewhat useful for more high-level concepts and understanding the idea of a computer. However, after a big revamp in the Spring, it's still undergoing significant changes. If I were you, I would wait at least another semester for them to iterate an continue to make 61C a better experience than it has been in the past (not great, to say the least)

I haven't taken CS 188, but from what I understand from other people its a very fun/interesting CS class with a lower workload than most.

CS 61C was by far my favorite lower division course and taught me a great deal about how a computer works at a fundamental level, and I still run into questions related to the material during interviews. CS 188 is an important class, but there's a reason why 61C is required.

I'm a newly-declared CS major going into my junior year. My primary CS interest is in AI, particularly in NLP, and I'd like to work in industry after graduate school.

I am faced with the decision between taking CS 61C and CS 188 (also taking Stat 135 and Info 159). On the one hand, 61C is useful for software engineering positions such as the internships I will be applying for over the summer, but on the other, 188 is very useful for later classes in ML, NLP, and computer vision. I should also note that I may not be able to fit in 188 if I do not take it this semester, but I can likely move 61C to next semester provided that it does not conflict with 189.

I would really appreciate any advice on which class I should take to best meet my goals. Thanks everyone!
history.subject: 61C vs. 188
